review_blob:
750ml poured into a tulip.

A - Fairly clear, reddish amber color with some white head that has some red tones as well. Lots of bubbles in this one - champagne like.

A - Some dried cherries, some barnyard scents, and oak.

T - Some brett funk, dry cherry taste, oak, very slight sweetness, some tartness, and a hint of vanilla.

P - A lot of carbonation here, like I said earlier, champagne like. Thin tasting, finishes dry with a slight tartness.

O - I would have liked a bit more sweetness in this one. Overall, enjoyable and the price was fantastic for the quality.

Served in a tulip glass.

AROMA:  The aroma of this beer is unbelievable, really good!  Lots of fruit, and some sweetness.
APPEARANCE:  Golden color with some hints of red.  Quite a bit of white frothy head.
TASTE:  The passion fruit is really prominent - almost like passion fruit tea.  There are other fruit tastes here too - raspberries and cranberries.  Some spices and coriander are also present.  This is real dry and there is little sweetness.
PALATE:  Light bodied and a bit oily.  Better than average carbonation.
OVERALL:  Very different and intriguing, I liked this but I think it could have used a bit more sweetness.

750 ml poured into a snifter and shared with a friend.

AROMA: Some chocolate malt, peaches, and some funkiness.
APPEARANCE: Dark chocolate brown, thick, and creamy brown head.
TASTE: Peach flavor is the main event here, malt, some sourness, coffee, and finishes with a hint of chocolate.
PALATE: Full bodied with better than average carbonation.
OVERALL Yes, there is quite bit of peach flavor, but that is why I like this one so much coupled with the sour fruit notes.  For me, the flavors come together extremely well.  Definitely worth picking up if you like fruit in porters.

Growler poured into a pint glass.

AROMA: Peach and banana aroma, somewhat musty.  Nothing special here.
APPEARANCE: Like the deScription says, auburn in color with a slight strawberry hues that is visible when poured.  Plenty of cream colored head that slowly dissipates and clings to the glass.
TASTE: The taste is pretty simple, slightly tart peach taste with a bit of sweet malt.
PALATE:  Light bodied, cream texture.  Plentiful carbonation and the finish is sweet.
OVERALL:  Picked up a growler of this because it sounded quite refreshing and was released the weekend of the 4th of July with a patriotic name.  It met my expectations.

22 oz bottle poured into a snifter.

AROMA: Piney hops, brown sugar,  plums, toffee malt, & boozey.
APPEARANCE:  Hazy burnt amber, off white head that dissipates leaving some skim and a ring around the glass.
TASTE: Piney hops, bitter, grapefruit, slight malt taste, but the hops dominate.
PALATE:Medium bodied, slick texture, average carbonation.  Finishes bitter!
OVERALL: A pretty solid offering from Half Acre.  Im glad I got to try it - this is definitely a sipper.  There is fair amount of boozey taste to this one.

16 oz can poured into a pint glass:

AROMA: Some citrus fruit and faint hops.
APPEARANCE:  Golden color, lots of nice white head.
TASTE: Some citrus, tropical fruit, slight hop bitterness.
PALATE: Light bodied, lots of carbonation, finishes crisp.
OVERALL:  Nice beer, glad I bought a four pack.  Id buy this one again.

12 oz bottle poured into a pint glass.

AROMA: Caramel malt, somewhat yeasty.
APPEARANCE: Hazy copper color, minimal head that clings in a ring around the glass.
TASTE:  Caramel malt, some bitterness, hint of citrus.
PALATE: Light bodied, thin texture, and bitter finish.
OVERALL:  Nice to try, but most likely wont seek this out again.

22 oz bomber poured into a pint glass. 

AROMA: Some malt, faint hops. Slight lemon. 
APPEARANCE: Nice look, rusty colored, some cream colored head.  Good carbonation. 
TASTE: Sweet caramel malt, some bitterness, citrus, vanilla, maybe a bit off toffee.  
PALATE: Light bodies, somewhat creamy mouthfeel. 
OVERALL: A good offering by Half Acre, nothing that is going to wow you here, but it does deliver.

Batch 5 poured into a Russian River tulip - Thanks Marco!

AROMA: Lemon, slight funk, green grapes and sour aroma.
APPEARANCE: Hazy straw color with white dead the slowly dissipates.
TASTE: Lemon, sweet malt, lemony sourness, sour green apple taste, green grapes.
PALATE: Medium body, above average carbonation.  Finish is tart and lingers for a bit.
OVERALL: This is fantastic!  Will definitely seek out again.

22 oz bottle poured into a Russian River tulip.

AROMA: Currants, vanilla, black cherry, and malt.
APPEARANCE: Pours dark brown with a red hue, light brown head that dissipates fairly quickly leaving behind a ring around the grass with a little skim.
TASTE: A lot like the smell, currants, black cherries, vanilla, some sweet malt taste.  Some tartness in the finish along with currant and cherries.
PALATE: Light bodied with a somewhat creamy texture.  Lingering finish that is slightly tart.
OVERALL:  Great collaboration.  Im glad I purchased a couple of these.   Too bad it was a small batch brew!
beer_name: Half Acre Pipeworks Struise Small Animal Big Machine

review_blob:
22 oz bottle poured into a Russian River tulip.

AROMA: Bready malt, faint hops and alcohol.
APPEARANCE: Hazy copper color with some off white head the dissipates into a ring round the glass and bit of skim.
TASTE: Sweet malty taste at first, then hop bitterness, finishes with malt and hop balance.  This is really balanced!
PALATE: Medium bodied with creamy texture.  Average carbonation.
OVERALL:  I acquired this as an extra in a trade.  Quite a treat!  If you like balanced double IPAs, this would be a  good one to try.

12 oz bottle (April 5, 2011 date) poured into Russian River tulip.

AROMA: Doughy, yeasty, and citrus.
APPEARANCE: Poured a hazy straw color with some head that dissipates quickly with some remaining skim.
TASTE: Citrus, slight funk, some sweet malt, a bit tart but finishes dry and a bit sweet.
PALATE: Light bodied and slightly creamy. Average carbonation.
OVERALL:  Ive been into saisons for a few years now and have overlooked this offering many times.  This is a pretty solid beer that Id buy again.

12oz bottle poured into a Russian River tulip.

AROMA:  Big citrus and floral aroma.
APPEARANCE: Clear golden color with some frothy head, some of it clinging to the glass.
TASTE: Citrus, piney, floral with a somewhat sweet malt undertone.  
PALATE: Light bodied with a slightly creamy texture.  Average carbonation.  Finishes with a lingering bitterness.
OVERALL:  New Glarus hit it out of the park with this one.  Too bad it is not in their year round or seasonal lineup.

22 oz bottle poured into a Grumpy Troll snifter.

AROMA:  Bitter chocolate, vanilla, dates, roasted notes, and alcohol.
APPEARANCE:  Dark black, very little head - brownish in color.
TASTE: Chocolate - more on the dark and bitter side, vanilla, dates, brown sugar, dark fruits, plums, and roasted malt.
PALATE: Nice mouthfeel, full bodied, creamy, and soft.  Bitter chocolate finishes that resonates on the lips and roof of your mouth.
OVERALL:  Poured this one with tempered expectations.  Regardless of the hype around this one, this is a pretty good beer!  By the way, I enjoyed this while eating Portillos chocolate cake - one heck of a great combo!
beer_name: Goose Island Big John Imperial Stout

review_blob:
375ml poured into RR Tulip.

AROMA: Vinegar, pears, funk & apples.
APPEARANCE: Orange hue, small amount of head that hangs around the glass.
TASTE: Sweetness at first, tart apples, pears, very slight wood taste.
PALATE: Creamy texture, some carbonation, bitter on the roof of the mouth.
OVERALL: Im really impressed with this beer.  Nice job Two Brothers!

22 oz bottle - poured into a tulip glass

AROMA: A hint of brett, some fruit coming through, some floral.
APPEARANCE: Slightly amber in color with minimal white head.
TASTE: Some spice, flowery, just a hint of tartness, a bit of dried cherries, wheres the funk?
PALATE: Light to medium bodied, decent carbonation, and slightly creamy.
OVERALL:  Not exactly what I was hoping it would be.  I was looking for something more sour.  I have had this on draft before about a month ago and I remembering it being a bit better on draft.
beer_name: New Belgium Lips of Faith - Vrienden

review_blob:
750 ml bottle - poured into a pint glass

AROMA: Hoppy and malty.
APPEARANCE:  Pours dark brownish to black.  A lot of head on this one that is more on the creamy side in color.  
TASTE: Piney hops and roasted malts.  The hop taste dominates though.
PALATE: Medium bodied, good amount of carbonation with a slightly bitter finish.
OVERALL:  A really good Black IPA, this is about the 5th one Ive had in this style and is near the top IMO (the others Stone Sublimely, Sprecher Black IPA, Lakefront IBA, & Clown Shoes Hoppy Feet).
beer_name: Odell Mountain Standard Double Black IPA

review_blob:
2011 Release - 25.4 oz bottle - poured into 10 oz snifter

AROMA: Dates, oak, chocolate, brown sugar, and vanilla.
APPEARANCE: Poured pitch black and thick.  Slightly more than minimal head that was dark brown in color.
TASTE: Intense flavor.  There is a lot going on here.  Chocolate, vanilla, cinnamon, some bitterness, finishes slightly spicy with a lingering chocolate taste.
PALATE: Medium to full bodied, creamy, and a bit of carbonation.  Finishes spicy with some chocolate.
OVERALL:  I feel very lucky to have acquired this via trade (thanks clintonpuckett - BA).  This is the fist time that I have tried a stout with chiles in it and now this is one of my favorites.  Excellent job Cigar City!

330ml bottle poured into a tulip glass.

AROMA: Citrus, floral, lemon grass, sweet candy.
APPEARANCE: Golden blond color.  Lots of frothy white head.  
TASTE: Bitter citrus taste, some sweetness, hint of a wit beer taste, and bready.
PALATE: Light bodied, creamy texture, finish is bitter and abrupt. 
OVERALL:  A very refreshing beer.

16oz can poured into a pint glass.

AROMA: Malt, roasted coffee, hint of chocolate.
APPEARANCE: Coffee colored with very nice cream head.
TASTE: Roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, light bitterness. 
PALATE: Medium bodied, creamy texture, lingering coffee taste.
OVERALL:   Great go to beer.

16 oz can dated 2/7/2011.

AROMA: Hops! Some malt.
APPEARANCE:  Copper color.  Aggressive pour leads to some head that slowly dissipates.
TASTE:  Poured from refrigerated can.  Initial taste is hops!  Nice and bitter with a slight malt backbone.  Citrus tasting.  I let this one warm up a bit.  Good thing I did.  As it warmed, additional tastes came out.  Most notably, almost like an bitter orange taste   The malt taste shined.
PALATE:  Pretty darn bitter.  Light bodied with a bitter finish.
OVERALL: Nothing new here, this is a great beer!

12oz bottle poured into a tulip.  Not sure what vintage this is.  Purchased in Madison, Wisconsin in late January.

AROMA: This is different, picking up scents of fruit and peanuts?
APPEARANCE: Golden color, minimal head.
TASTE: Slightly sweet, bready, fruity (almost like strawberries).  I like the after taste on this one, some malt, a little sweet, and banana.
PALATE: Medium bodied, creamy texture and the finish is long lasting with bready / banana taste.
OVERALL:  A decent beer that drinks real well for being 9.5%.  There really is not hint of alcohol here.
beer_name: Ale Asylum Mercy Belgian Grand Cru

review_blob:
750ml poured into a tulip glass.

AROMA: Vinegar, berries, vanilla, funky, sour, and leather.
APPEARANCE: Cloudy dark brownish color, when held to the light there are shades of red.  Minimal head, some bubbles.
TASTE: There is a  lot going on here.  But it works real well.  Cranberry, vinegar, sour cherries, oak, and  vanilla.
PALATE: Medium body, balanced, creamy texture, some carbonation, finishes tart and dry with an slight oak taste.
OVERALL:  This is a great beer!  Previous experience with Cigar City sours has not been the greatest and this is the first sour Ive had from The Bruery.  These two breweries teamed up to make a fantastic beer.

12 oz bottle poured into tulip glass.

AROMA: Lots of malt and some fruit.

APPEARANCE: Copper - orange color with little head.

TASTE: Sweet, bready taste.  Some spice, lots of citrus hops.  Finishes dry and bitter.

PALATE: Medium body, soft carbonation, really bitter finish.

OVERALL:  Interesting beer, not too far off from some Barleywines Ive had.
beer_name: Sand Creek Franks Wild Ryed India Pale Ale

review_blob:
Goblet consumed at the Three Floyds Brewpub on 4/15/2011.

AROMA: Smokiness and malt.  I did not detect any honey.
APPEARANCE: Dark brown with light brown head and quite a bit of lacing.
TASTE: Starts sweet, roasty, malty, with a bitter finish.   
PALATE: Medium bodied, with a creamy mouthfeel, yet oily too.
OVERALL:  This was a great beer.  If I hadnt already purchased two growlers of Zombie Dust, I would have bought a growler of this.  Try this one if you get a chance!

650ml bottle poured into a tulip.

AROMA: Belgian yeast, slight citrus, pears, sweet.
APPEARANCE: Pale golden color, slight haze, frothy white foam.
TASTE: First taste is light sweetness and slight floral, apple, that turns bitter.
PALATE: Light bodied, creamy mouthfeel, lively carbonation that finishes bitter.
OVERALL: Picked this up out of market because I hadnt seen it in my area before.  Decent beer, not one that I will probably try again though.
beer_name: New Belgium Lips of Faith - Belgian Style Blond Ale

review_blob:
Growler courtesy of slvrmon82.  Thanks!

AROMA: Lemon, sweet, and funky
APPEARANCE:  Poured into a Central Waters snifter.  Aggressive pour resulted into 1/2 inch of head.  Lots of lacing and foam clinging to the glass like soap.  Golden color that is a bit hazy.
TASTE: Citrus, mild bitterness, slightly sour and sweet.  Mild tea flavors in the background.  
PALATE: Light bodied, thin texture and slightly bitter finish.
OVERALL: Wow, really lucky I got to try this.  The beer is perfect for a hot summer day.  A sessionable beer that is full of taste.

12 oz glass poured into a pint glass (no hop cone).

AROMA: Malty 
APPEARANCE: Amber orange color that is hazy.  Pour resulted in a slight head that dissipated into a ring around the glass with a little bit of skim.
TASTE First taste is medium sweet malt.  The taste turns to light bitter then finishes much bitter.  There is some floral taste in there.
PALATE: Medium bodies with a creamy texture.
OVERALL: Well balanced.  A pretty decent beer.  If you are into malty IPAs then this is a good one to try.

16 oz can poured into pint glass.  Nice head that remained about a 1/4 inch thick the entire time.  Smell is malt and hops.  Taste is malty and slight hops.  The malt taste definitely takes the front seat here.  Even at 60 IBU, the hop taste is minimal.

12 oz bottle poured into a pint glass.  Picked up this bottle as a single in Madison, WI and paid no attention to the style.  Completely surprised when I poured this, I was expecting a stout.  Aggressive pour resulted in a nice heard with some lacing.  The color is dark golden.  Aroma is coffee and chocolate.  Almost smells like someone is brewing coffee.  Taste is coffee and a slight sweetness that finishes a tad bitter.  Pleasantly surprised by this one.

Big thanks to millah (BA) for hooking me up with this one.  I had heard the coffee taste was starting to fade so I decided it was time.  If it has faded, cant believe the intensity of the coffee it it were fresher.

AROMA: Intense espresso aroma, some raisin scent, picking up some chocolate and vanilla.
APPEARANCE:  Poured into a Grump Troll snifter.  Pours dark dark brown with some lighter brown colors visible on the edges.  Just a tad bit of head that dissipates and then a very thin layer remains in the glass.  There is also some lacing and with each pour it clings to the glass.
TASTE: First taste is a warming and sweet and quickly turns to bitter chocolate, coffee, buttermilk, lingering taste of German chocolate cake and vanilla.
PALATE: Silky smooth, yet full bodied.  Finish is long.
OVERALL: Great beer that goes down too easy.  Nearly 10% ABV, you cant even tell.  It is too bad this isnt part of their seasonal lineup.

2009 Vintage bottled August 14, 2009.

AROMA: Aroma of berries and wine.
APPEARANCE: Pours a cloudy reddish gold color with lots of soap like foam.  Head is white with a red hue.
TASTE: First taste is tart berries and earthy, then quickly turns tart and finishes try with a woody taste.
PALATE: Crisp and lively, lots of carbonation here.
OVERALL: Im a really big fan of this beer.  In my opinion, it is the best of the three sisters.  I still have one bottle of 2009 left and have yet to try the 2010.  Can the "new" Goose Island keep up the quality?  I hope so!

AROMA: Combination of cereal & floral.
APPEARANCE: Pale golden color.  Thin head.
TASTE: Hoppy, medium bitterness.
PALATE: Light bodied, some carbonation, finishes bitter.
OVERALL: Picked this up in Ames, Iowa.  A good pale ale, however Im not sure how fresh it was.

AROMA: Slight hop aroma.
APPEARANCE: Golden, mostly clear.  Slight head with some lacing.  
TASTE: Lightly bitter with some sweetness in the finish.
PALATE: Light body & lively.
OVERALL: A very good pale ale that is easy to find and reasonably priced.
UPDATED: MAR 20, 2011

Poured from a bomber bottle the last week of January 2011 into a tulip glass.  Appearance is cloudy golden.  Aroma is orange zest .  Great taste, that changes from a fantastic sweetness to bitter rather quickly.  Taste of citrus and hops.  Thanks for coming to Chicago!  I will definitely purchase again!

650ml bottle poured into a tulip glass.  Aggressive pour resulted in minimal head with some lacing.  Fruity aroma, I pick up a tangerine like smell but do not notice the grapefruit.  The first noticeable taste is bitter fruit that quickly becomes malty and finishes bitter with a very slight sweet taste.  This is a really good Double IPA.  I should have tried this side by side with Pliny!

Bottle dated 010311, acquired via trade!  Aggressive pour into a tulip glass results in thin white head that begins to lace.  Color is light golden with some carbonation.  Aroma is hops!  Taste is bittersweet at first then quickly turn bitter and finishes with a piney taste.  Very light tasting and a thin texture.   I really enjoyed this one and would trade for or purchase it again!

Acquired via trade, bottle dated 011211.  Poured into a tulip glass aggressively and resulted in minimal head and some lacing.  Aroma is hops and pine.  Color is pale golden.  Taste doesnt start bitter but finishes that way.  Light bodies with a slightly creamy texture.  There is minimal carbonation.  What else can I say that hasnt already been said?  Im really glad I was able to acquire this and it has left me wanting more!

Aggressive poor results in a 1/2 inch head that dissipates into a very thin covering rather quickly.  Aroma is yeasty, there is something else there but Im having a hard time picking it out.  Color is brownish with a slight red hue.  Taste is slightly bitter and slightly sweet.  The texture is oily and it finishes with a bitter taste.  For what it is worth, this beer goes great with Buffalo Wings!

Acquired via the BOM Club.  Slight hint of hops and yeast.  Pours a golden color with quite a bid of head that thins out but never goes away. Taste is bitter at first and then moves to slightly sweet with a bitter finish.  Mouth feel is slightly  oily.  would drink it again.

Poured into a Central Waters snifter.  The color could pass as a dark coffee.  Very thin head that is off white and rings around the glass. 

Coffee aroma with a hint of dark chocolate.  The flavor is very similar to the aroma.  The coffee is present first, followed by a bitter chocolate taste and finishes with a coffee taste that has a slight hint of wood.  

This is a pretty good coffee stout and I would drink it again.

Poured into a tulip at the Goose Island Brewery.  Slight head, aroma of bourbon and slightly funky.  Sour and tart fruit taste.  It really works well.  The bourbon flavor is present and makes this a remarkable beer.  Bottle this please!

Consumed on premise at Goose Island.  Poured into a snifter.  Was cola colored with a slight head.  Aroma of hops and malt.  Light bodied with a smooth somewhat oily taste.  Tastes of hops and malt.  This was a great collaboration.  It would be nice to see it bottled!
beer_name: Goose Island A Beer Named Sue

review_blob: 12 oz bottle poured into snifter.   Dark brown with slight reddish hue.  Poured with very little head.   Aroma of malt and cherry.   Starts of slightly sweet then finishes tart and dry.  Medium body with a creamy texture.  I was looking for a beer that would be similar to New Glarus Cherry Stout, this is not it.  However, it was pretty good and I would purchase again.

Aroma of banana, yeast, and orange zest.  Poured a cloudy yellow color with minimal head and little carbonation.  Spiced orange taste with hints of banana and coriander.  Medium body with a citrus finish.  A great summer beer, but can be enjoyed year round.
A light and refreshing beer.  Pours a light clear yellow color.  Small amount of head.  A bit better than most lagers.  A beer that would serve as a decent session beer.

Purchased at the brewery the day of the release.  This is the second bottle I have tasted (Previous was in mid September) and this beer is the first gueuze Ive had.  Poured a clear light copper color.  Slight head with decent amount of carbonation.  Aroma reminds me of apple cider vinegar.  There is a slight sweet taste to this that is quickly replaced by tartness.  It finishes dry and sour.  Tastes of apples and grapes.  Little to no oak taste that I can notice.  Im very impressed with this beer.  I have one more to drink and I will compare notes in another couple of months.

Poured with a tan head and some lace. Tanish brown head. Nice roasty malty nose with a little dark ripe fruit, cocoa, coffee, a hint of vanilla and chocolate. Flavor is basically the same as aroma. In spite of the richness its fairly drinkable. Very full flavored.

Aroma is of raspberry and is fruity.  Pours brownish read with slight head that dissipated quickly.  Bo carbonation to be seen.  Tastes of raspberries and is a bit sour.  The malt taste is present in the background.  Medium bodied with a creamy miuthfeel.  Finishes slightly bitter and dry.
